page.title: 03LAND RECLAMATION-King Lud's.
page.content: Much of the southern third of this area was occupied until recently by the northern part of a wartime airfield. Much of this land has been returned to farmland. Only those areas of extensive surface and underground installations, such as runways and shelters are not now farmed. Even these latter areas are however utilised either as sites for crop stores or other farm buildings, or for woodland, both for timber and as cover for game-birds. Some of the old military installations are located in the Site of Special Scientific Interest at King Lud's Entrenchments, currently the site of nature conservation work.
